meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of fish.
meanings.sent1: The ichthyic scales of the fish shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The aquarium was filled with various ichthyic creatures swimming gracefully.
meanings.sent3: The ichthyic pattern on the swim trunks made them look like a real fish!
meanings.sent4: Her flowing hair moved like an ichthyic tail in the water.
meanings.sent5: The ichthyic smell of the seafood market lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a fish.
meanings.sent1: The ichthyic fins of the mermaid glimmered as she swam.
meanings.sent2: The sculpture had an ichthyic shape, resembling a fish in motion.
meanings.sent3: The ichthyic costume for the school play made him look like a fish out of water!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up from deep within, sounding ichthyic and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The ichthyic design on the wallpaper gave the room an underwater feel.
